from database import create_db_and_tables, engine
from sqlmodel import Session, select
from models import TeamMember, TimeOffSyncResult, MemberOOOChange
from crud import tick_slack_ooo_status, apply_timeoff_entries

create_db_and_tables\(\)
with Session\(engine\) as db:
    activated, restored = tick_slack_ooo_status\(db\)
    print\(f'tick: activated={activated}, restored={restored}'\)
    # Verify new fields exist
    member = db.exec\(select\(TeamMember\)\).first\(\)
    print\(f'slack_ooo_start={member.slack_ooo_start}, slack_ooo_until={member.slack_ooo_until}'\)
    print\('Schema OK'\)
" 2>&1)

Bash(cd /c/Users/riddh/entreprise-planning/backend && python -c "
# Quick smoke-test apply_timeoff_entries with a fake entry
from database import engine
from sqlmodel import Session
from models import TimeOffSyncResult
from crud import apply_timeoff_entries
from slack_parser import TimeOffEntry
from datetime import datetime, timezone, timedelta

future_entry = TimeOffEntry\(
    sent_at=datetime.now\(timezone.utc\).isoformat\(\),
    sender='jordan.lee',
    message='OOO next week Mon-Fri',
    person_username='Jordan Lee',
    start_date=\(datetime.now\(timezone.utc\) + timedelta\(days=7\)\).strftime\('%m/%d/%Y'\),
    end_date=\(datetime.now\(timezone.utc\) + timedelta\(days=11\)\).strftime\('%m/%d/%Y'\),
    reason='vacation',
    coverage_username='Alex Kim',
\)
now_entry = TimeOffEntry\(
    sent_at=datetime.now\(timezone.utc\).isoformat\(\),
    sender='maya.patel',
    message='OOO today and tomorrow',
    person_username='Maya Patel',
    start_date=datetime.now\(timezone.utc\).strftime\('%m/%d/%Y'\),
    end_date=None,
    reason=None,
    coverage_username=None,
\)

with Session\(engine\) as db:
    result = apply_timeoff_entries\(db, [future_entry, now_entry]\)
    print\(f'detected={result.detected}, applied={result.applied}, pending={result.pending}, skipped={result.skipped}'\)
    for c in result.changes:
        print\(f'  {c.memberName}: pending={c.pending}, start={c.startDate}, end={c.endDate}'\)
" 2>&1)
